item.title: Earlier report should read UNSWEPT' not unsweetened!, 15th December
item.description:
Gullies and pavements not been swept for weeks. Sweeper not doing job properly, wasting time unlike the previous two sweepers who were thorough. He leaves bags where they can't be seen by van men, all along the street gathering more rubbish..
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Narford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large piles of debris blocking communal areas, 15th December
item.description:
These piles have been collecting for over two weeks. Some items including the two large metal frames against the fence have been there for months. Not sanitary, unsafe and a general hazard. Please remedy immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rouel Road, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Litter and mess from homeless, 15th December
item.description:
Someone else has appeared outside whole foods sleeping on the streets and leaving a huge mess. Bottles of urine and takeaway boxes and Tupperware scattered across next to pillows and blankets as well as a shopping trolley full of crap.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilmer Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Piles of leaves unsweetened for weeks, 15th December
item.description:
Pavement and gutter in Narford Road from 1 to 13 not swept for many weeks. Ditto nearby roads. Sweeper does poor job unlike previous man. Bags left for pickup randomly where they can't be seen by collectors and are hazard. Chap needs training to do hi job
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Narford Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Second report: restaurant dumping garbage on the pavement, 15th December
item.description:
This is the second time I am reporting this issue. It seems like this restaurant continues to distribute is rubbish all over the pavement with a lack of care for residents and pedestrians. It’s unfair having to see this garbage in front of my house everyday. Nor is it hygienic considering the waste which is being thrown out which will likely cause infestation of rodents. There is also a fire risk considering the cardboard and possible flammable materials within the the overflowing waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, South Street, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
